Name: Oblong Stela with Chaplet and Praying Monk
Description: The ornamentation of the oblong stela, an upright stone with a sculpted surface, is in high relief. A pediment, or triangular space that forms the gable of a low-pitched roof, tops this oblong stela. Inside the pediment are two peacocks, one on each side. Over their heads is an ornament.Beneath the pediment is a chaplet, or small shrine, formed of grape clusters between two lines. On the top of the chaplet is a plant, and below is a round inscription that reads "Lazaros." The chaplet is supported by two columns that are decorated with plant shapes.Beneath the chaplet is a monk in prayer with his feet visible from beneath his robe. His hair covers his forehead.
